meanings.definition: To make a mess of; bungle
meanings.sent1: She flubbed the recipe by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent2: He always flubbed his lines during the school play.
meanings.sent3: The chef flubbed the dish so badly that even the dog wouldn't eat it.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to fix the computer only flubbed the situation further.
meanings.sent5: The magician flubbed his trick, revealing the hidden card too soon.

meanings.sent1: The team flubbed their chances of winning by missing easy shots.
meanings.sent2: She flubbed the exam because she didn't study enough.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to impress his crush flubbed when he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The singer flubbed the high note, causing the audience to cringe.
meanings.sent5: The actor flubbed his lines so badly that the scene had to be re-shot multiple times.

meanings.sent1: Making a flubbed in the presentation cost him the deal.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit choice was a flubbed for the formal event.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's flubbed in grading the tests caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent4: The politician's flubbed during the speech became a viral meme.
meanings.sent5: The comedian turned his flubbed into a hilarious joke, winning over the audience.
